description: The user is seeking a non-CCG Oceanographic Research Vessel for a multi-day survey mission in the Newfoundland and Labrador region. The vessel will be used to collect biological samples of sea cucumber, starfish, and other invertebrates, and to assess the status of sea cucumber stocks. The survey will be conducted in September and will last for 10 consecutive days. A dredge will be towed and catch will be dumped on the deck, sorted, and subsampled by DFO technicians. The purpose of this mission is to assess the status of sea cucumber stocks on the St. Pierre Bank (NAFO Subdiv. 3Ps) and to inform the annual Sea Cucumber fishery beyond 2023.

## **Government Tender Announcement**

### **Title**
Vessel and Crew to Support the Sea Cucumber Mission in Newfoundland and Labrador

### **Reference Number**
PW-22-01005538

### **Solicitation Number**
30003407

### **Publication Date**
August 26, 2022

### **Tender Closing Date**
September 6, 2022, at 1:00 PM EST

### **Procurement Category**
SRV (Service)

### **Procurement Method**
Competitive - Open bidding

### **Procurement Notice**
Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) invites proposals from companies capable of providing a vessel to support the Sea Cucumber Survey mission in Newfoundland and Labrador. The successful contractor will be responsible for providing a non-CCG Oceanographic Research Vessel to conduct a 10-day survey, commencing as early as September 9, 2022.

### **Objective of the Requirement**

The primary objective of the Sea Cucumber Survey is to assess the status of Sea Cucumber stocks on the St. Pierre Bank (NAFO Subdiv. 3Ps). Additionally, the survey aims to collect biological samples, including counts and size-specific weights of sea cucumber, and determine the abundance of sea cucumber and starfish.

### **Scope of Work**

* Steam to predetermined offshore locations within the two Sea Cucumber fishing areas
* Tow a modified sea urchin dredge for 0.5 nautical miles at a speed of 2.5 knots
* Maintain a 3:1 warp ratio
* Dump and sort dredge catch, with the assistance of charter crew
* DFO staff will count, weigh, and measure catch or subsample of catch
* Conduct the survey for 10 consecutive days, preferably between September 9-19

### **Background**

The Sea Cucumber Survey has been cancelled in previous years due to the COVID-19 pandemic and vessel maintenance requirements. This survey is essential to provide updated stock advice to Resource Management and to analyze the impact of the re-implemented fishery in the south-east area.

### **Contact Information**

* Plante, Karine, DFO Tenders, at DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca or 506-429-3346

### **Notice and Documents**

Please refer to the tender publication notice and download the RFP/.component files from the Government of Canada's procurements web portal: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en
